# oneMeanTest

An R package for performing a one-sample t-test for a population mean
when the variance is unknown, developed as a STAT 181 (Statistical
Computing) project at the Institute of Statistics, UP Los Banos.

## Installation

You can install the development version from GitHub:

install.packages(“devtools”) \# if needed
devtools::install_github(“KingSSIBAL/oneMeantTest”)

Then load the package:

library(oneMeanTest)

## Main functionality

- [`one_mean_test()`](reference/one_mean_test.md)  
  Perform a one-sample t-test for a population mean with unknown
  variance.  
  Returns:

  - test statistic and degrees of freedom
  - p-value
  - confidence interval for the mean
  - decision to reject or fail to reject (H_0)
  - plain-language interpretation
  - optional assumption checks

- [`descriptive_stats()`](reference/descriptive_stats.md)  
  Basic descriptive statistics (n, mean, median, sd, se, variance,
  quantiles, IQR) for a numeric sample.

- [`check_assumptions()`](reference/check_assumptions.md)  
  Check normality and other basic assumptions for using the one-sample
  t-test.

- [`bootstrap_ttest()`](reference/bootstrap_ttest.md)  
  Bootstrap-based one-sample t-test: bootstrap distribution of the
  t-statistic, bootstrap p-value, and percentile CI for the mean.

- `power_analysis_one_mean()`  
  Wrapper around
  [`stats::power.t.test()`](https://rdrr.io/r/stats/power.t.test.html)
  for one-sample t-test power analysis (solve for power or for required
  sample size).

- [`plot()`](https://rdrr.io/r/graphics/plot.default.html) methods for
  objects of class `oneMeanTest` and `oneMeanTest_bootstrap`  
  Visualizations including:

  - t-distribution with observed statistic and critical region
  - histogram and boxplot of the data with (\_0) and sample mean
  - normal Q-Q plot
  - confidence interval plot for the mean

## Quick example

library(oneMeanTest)

set.seed(123) x \<- rnorm(30, mean = 5, sd = 2)

res \<- one_mean_test( x, mu0 = 5, alternative = “two.sided”, alpha =
0.05, conf.level = 0.95, check_assumptions = TRUE )

res \# print main results plot(res, “t”) \# t-distribution with test
statistic plot(res, “ci”) \# confidence interval for the mean

## When to use this package

Use `oneMeanTest` when:

- You have one numeric sample (independent observations).
- You want to test a hypothesis about a single population mean with
  unknown variance.
- The population is approximately normal (or the sample size is
  moderately large).
- You want classical t-test results, and optionally bootstrap-based
  inference and power analysis.

This package was created for STAT 181, 1st Semester 2025–2026, as an
educational tool for understanding the one-sample t-test and related
concepts.

# Package index

## All functions

- [`bootstrap_ttest()`](bootstrap_ttest.md) : Bootstrap one-sample
  t-test
- [`check_assumptions()`](check_assumptions.md) : Assumption checks for
  one-sample t-test
- [`cohens_d()`](cohens_d.md) : Calculate Cohen's d effect size
- [`descriptive_stats()`](descriptive_stats.md) : Descriptive statistics
  for a numeric sample
- [`effect_size_t_test()`](effect_size_t_test.md) : Calculate detectable
  effect size for given power
- [`format_decision()`](format_decision.md) : Format decision for
  display
- [`format_ttest_report()`](format_ttest_report.md) : Format T-test
  Report
- [`get_alternative_text()`](get_alternative_text.md) : Get alternative
  hypothesis text
- [`interpret_assumptions()`](interpret_assumptions.md) : Generate
  assumption check interpretation
- [`interpret_ci()`](interpret_ci.md) : Interpret confidence interval
- [`interpret_effect_size()`](interpret_effect_size.md) : Interpret
  effect size
- [`interpret_p_value()`](interpret_p_value.md) : Interpret p-value
  strength
- [`oneMeanTest-package`](oneMeanTest.md)
  [`oneMeanTest`](oneMeanTest.md) : oneMeanTest: One-sample t-test
  package
- [`one_mean_test()`](one_mean_test.md) : One-sample t-test for a
  population mean (unknown variance)
- [`plot(`*`<oneMeanTest>`*`)`](plot.oneMeanTest.md) : Plot method for
  oneMeanTest objects
- [`plot(`*`<oneMeanTest_bootstrap>`*`)`](plot.oneMeanTest_bootstrap.md)
  : Plot bootstrap distribution
- [`plot_boxplot()`](plot_boxplot.md) : Boxplot with outlier
  identification
- [`plot_ci()`](plot_ci.md) : Plot confidence interval
- [`plot_distribution()`](plot_distribution.md) : Plot data distribution
  with test information
- [`plot_histogram()`](plot_histogram.md) : Histogram with normal curve
- [`plot_power_curve()`](plot_power_curve.md) : Plot power curve
- [`plot_qq()`](plot_qq.md) : Q-Q plot for normality assessment
- [`power_t_test()`](power_t_test.md) : Power Analysis Functions for
  One-Sample T-Test
- [`print(`*`<oneMeanTest>`*`)`](print.oneMeanTest.md) : Print Method
  for oneMeanTest Objects
- [`print(`*`<oneMeanTest_bootstrap>`*`)`](print.oneMeanTest_bootstrap.md)
  : Print method for bootstrap one-sample t-test
- [`report()`](report.md) : Report Methods for One-Sample T-Test
- [`sample_size_t_test()`](sample_size_t_test.md) : Calculate required
  sample size for desired power
- [`summary(`*`<oneMeanTest>`*`)`](summary.oneMeanTest.md) : Summary
  Method for oneMeanTest Objects
